items.name: Component_Animator
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Component_Animator
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Component_Animator extends gs.Component
    ###*
    * An animator-component allows to execute different kind of animations 
    * on a game object. The animations are using the game object's 
    * dstRect & offset-property to execute.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Component_Animator
    * @extends gs.Component
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: ->
        super
        
        @moveAnimation = new gs.Component_MoveAnimation()
        @pathAnimation = new gs.Component_PathAnimation()
        @zoomAnimation = new gs.Component_ZoomAnimation()
        @blendAnimation = new gs.Component_BlendAnimation()
        @blurAnimation = new gs.Component_BlurAnimation()
        @pixelateAnimation = new gs.Component_PixelateAnimation()
        @wobbleAnimation = new gs.Component_WobbleAnimation()
        @colorAnimation = new gs.Component_ColorAnimation()
        @imageAnimation = new gs.Component_ImageAnimation()
        @frameAnimation = new gs.Component_FrameAnimation()
        @fieldAnimation = new gs.Component_FieldAnimation()
        @shakeAnimation = new gs.Component_ShakeAnimation()
        @tintAnimation = new gs.Component_TintAnimation()
        @rotateAnimation = new gs.Component_RotateAnimation()
        @maskAnimation = new gs.Component_MaskAnimation()
        @l2dAnimation = new gs.Component_Live2DAnimation()
        
        ###*
        * Standard Callback Routine
        * @property callback
        * @type function
        * @private
        ###
        @callback = (object, animation) -> object.removeComponent(animation)
        
        @onBlendFinish = (object, animation, callback) -> 
            object.removeComponent(animation)
            callback?(object)
        
        
    ###*
    * Updates the animator.
    *
    * @method update
    ###
    update: ->
        super
        
        if @object.mask?.source?.videoElement?
            @object.mask.source.update()
            
    ###*
    * Moves the game object with a specified speed.
    *
    * @method move
    * @param {number} speedX The speed on x-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} speedY The speed on y-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type used for the animation.
    ###
    move: (speedX, speedY, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@moveAnimation)
        @moveAnimation.move(speedX, speedY, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @moveAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Moves the game object to a specified position.
    *
    * @method moveTo
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###  
    moveTo: (x, y, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@moveAnimation)
        @moveAnimation.moveTo(x, y, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @moveAnimation
    
    ###*
    * Moves the game object along a path.
    *
    * @method movePath
    * @param {Object} path The path to follow.
    * @param {gs.AnimationLoopType} loopType The loop-Type.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {Object[]} effects Optional array of effects executed during the path-movement like playing a sound.
    ###  
    movePath: (path, loopType, duration, easingType, effects) ->
        c = @object.findComponent("Component_PathAnimation")
        
        if c?
            c.loopType = loopType
        else
            @object.addComponent(@pathAnimation)
            @pathAnimation.start(path, loopType, duration, easingType, effects, @callback)
            
        return @pathAnimation
    
    ###*
    * Scrolls the game object with a specified speed.
    *
    * @method scroll
    * @param {number} speedX The speed on x-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} speedY The speed on y-axis in pixels per frame.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type used for the animation.
    ###
    scroll: (speedX, speedY, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@moveAnimation)
        @moveAnimation.scroll(speedX, speedY, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @moveAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Scrolls the game object to a specified position.
    *
    * @method scrollTo
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the position.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###  
    scrollTo: (x, y, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@moveAnimation)
        @moveAnimation.scrollTo(x, y, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @moveAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Scrolls the game object along a path.
    *
    * @method scrollPath
    * @param {Object} path The path to follow.
    * @param {gs.AnimationLoopType} loopType The loop-Type.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###  
    scrollPath: (path, loopType, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@pathAnimation)
        @pathAnimation.scroll(path, loopType, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @pathAnimation
    
        
    ###*
    * Zooms a game object to specified size.
    *
    * @method zoomTo
    * @param {number} x The x-axis zoom-factor.
    * @param {number} y The y-axis zoom-factor.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###      
    zoomTo: (x, y, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@zoomAnimation)
        @zoomAnimation.start(x, y, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @zoomAnimation
        
    
    ###*
    * Blends a game object to specified opacity.
    *
    * @method blendTo
    * @param {number} opacity The target opacity.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback called if blending is finished. 
    ###    
    blendTo: (opacity, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@blendAnimation)
        @blendAnimation.start(opacity, duration, easingType, gs.CallBack("onBlendFinish", this, callback)) 
        
        return @blendAnimation
     
    ###*
    * Animates a Live2D model parameter of a Live2D game object to a specified value.
    *
    * @method blendTo
    * @param {string} param The name of the parameter to animate.
    * @param {number} value The target value.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback called if blending is finished. 
    ###
    l2dParameterTo: (param, value, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@l2dAnimation)
        @l2dAnimation.start(param, value, duration, easingType, gs.CallBack("onBlendFinish", this, callback)) 
        
        return @l2dAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Blurs a game object to specified blur-power.
    *
    * @method blurTo
    * @param {number} power The target blur-power.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###     
    blurTo: (power, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@blurAnimation)
        @blurAnimation.start(power, duration, easingType) 
        
        return @blurAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Pixelates a game object to specified pixel-size/block-size
    *
    * @method pixelateTo
    * @param {number} width - The target block-width
    * @param {number} height - The target block-height
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###     
    pixelateTo: (width, height, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@pixelateAnimation)
        @pixelateAnimation.start(width, height, duration, easingType) 
        
        return @pixelateAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Wobbles a game object to specified wobble-power and wobble-speed.
    *
    * @method wobbleTo
    * @param {number} power The target wobble-power.
    * @param {number} speed The target wobble-speed.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###     
    wobbleTo: (power, speed, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@wobbleAnimation)
        @wobbleAnimation.start(power, speed, duration, easingType) 
        
        return @wobbleAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Colors a game object to a specified target color.
    *
    * @method colorTo
    * @param {Color} color The target color.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###  
    colorTo: (color, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@colorAnimation)
        @colorAnimation.start(color, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @colorAnimation
        
    ###*
    * An image animation runs from left to right using the game object's
    * image-property.
    *
    * @method changeImages
    * @param {Array} images An array of image names.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###      
    changeImages: (images, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@imageAnimation)
        @imageAnimation.start(images, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @imageAnimation
        
    ###*
    * A frame animation which modifies the game object's srcRect property
    * a play an animation.
    *
    * @method changeFrames
    * @param {gs.Rect[]} frames An array of source rectangles (frames).
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###      
    #changeFrames: (frames, duration, easingType) ->
    #    animation = new gs.Component_FrameAnimation()
    #    @object.addComponent(animation)
    #    animation.start(frames, duration, easingType, @callback)
       
    ###*
    * A frame animation which modifies the game object's srcRect property
    * a play an animation.
    *
    * @method playAnimation
    * @param {gs.Rect[]} frames An array of source rectangles (frames).
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###     
    playAnimation: (animationRecord) ->
        @frameAnimation.refresh(animationRecord)
        @object.addComponent(@frameAnimation)
        @frameAnimation.start(@callback)
        
        return @frameAnimation
       
    ###*
    * Changes a field of the game object to a specified value.
    *
    * @method change
    * @param {number} Value The target value.
    * @param {string} field The name of the field/property.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ###   
    change: (value, field, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@fieldAnimation)
        @fieldAnimation.start(value, field, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @fieldAnimation
       
    ###*
    * Shakes the game object horizontally using the game object's offset-property.
    *
    * @method shake
    * @param {gs.Range} range The horizontal shake-range.
    * @param {number} speed The shake speed.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ### 
    shake: (range, speed, duration, easing) ->
        @object.addComponent(@shakeAnimation)
        @shakeAnimation.start(range, speed, duration, easing, @callback)
        
        return @shakeAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Tints the game object to a specified tone.
    *
    * @method tintTo
    * @param {Tone} tone The target tone.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ### 
    tintTo: (tone, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@tintAnimation)
        @tintAnimation.start(tone, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @tintAnimation
    
    ###*
    * Rotates the game object around its anchor-point.
    *
    * @method rotate
    * @param {gs.RotationDirection} direction The rotation-direction.
    * @param {number} speed The rotation speed in degrees per frame.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ### 
    rotate: (direction, speed, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@rotateAnimation)
        @rotateAnimation.rotate(direction, speed, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @rotateAnimation
    
    ###*
    * Rotates the game object around its anchor-point to a specified angle.
    *
    * @method rotateTo
    * @param {number} angle The target angle.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    ### 
    rotateTo: (angle, duration, easingType) ->
        @object.addComponent(@rotateAnimation)
        @rotateAnimation.rotateTo(angle, duration, easingType, @callback)
        
        return @rotateAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Lets a game object appear on screen using a masking-effect.
    *
    * @method maskIn
    * @param {gs.Mask} mask The mask used for the animation.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###     
    maskIn: (mask, duration, easing, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@maskAnimation)
        @maskAnimation.maskIn(mask, duration, easing, (object, animation) -> object.removeComponent(animation); callback?(object);)
        
        return @maskAnimation
     
    ###*
    * Description follows...
    *
    * @method maskTo
    * @param {gs.Mask} mask The mask used for the animation.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###     
    maskTo: (mask, duration, easing, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@maskAnimation)
        @maskAnimation.maskTo(mask, duration, easing, (object, animation) -> object.removeComponent(animation); callback?(object);)
        
        return @maskAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Lets a game object disappear from screen using a masking-effect.
    *
    * @method maskOut
    * @param {gs.Mask} mask The mask used for the animation.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###  
    maskOut: (mask, duration, easing, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@maskAnimation)
        @maskAnimation.maskOut(mask, duration, easing, (object, animation) -> object.removeComponent(animation); callback?(object);)
        
        return @maskAnimation

    ###*
    * Lets a game object appear on screen from left, top, right or bottom using 
    * a move-animation
    *
    * @method moveIn
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the target-position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the target-position.
    * @param {number} type The movement-direction from where the game object should move-in.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###  
    moveIn: (x, y, type, duration, easing, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@moveAnimation)
        @moveAnimation.moveIn(x, y, type, duration, easing, (object, animation) -> 
            object.removeComponent(animation)
            callback?(object))
        
        return @moveAnimation
      
    ###*
    * Lets a game object disappear from screen to the left, top, right or bottom using 
    * a move-animation
    *
    * @method moveOut
    * @param {number} type The movement-direction in which the game object should move-out.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###    
    moveOut: (type, duration, easing, callback) ->
        @object.addComponent(@moveAnimation)
        @moveAnimation.moveOut(type, duration, easing, (object, animation) -> 
            object.removeComponent(animation)
            callback?(object)
        )
        
        return @moveAnimation
        
    ###*
    * Lets a game object appear on screen using blending.
    *
    * @method show
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easing The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###  
    show: (duration, easing, callback) ->
        @object.opacity = 0
        @object.visual?.update()
        
        return @blendTo(255, duration, easing, callback)
     
    ###*
    * Lets a game object disappear from screen using blending.
    *
    * @method hide
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easing The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###     
    hide: (duration, easing, callback) ->
        return @blendTo(0, duration, easing, callback)
       
    ###*
    * Changes visible-property to true. This method is deprecated.
    * 
    * @method open
    * @deprecated
    ###   
    open: -> @object.visible = yes
    
    ###*
    * Changes visible-property to false. This method is deprecated.
    * 
    * @method close
    * @deprecated
    ###   
    close: -> @object.visible = no
    
    ###*
    * Flashes the game object.
    *
    * @method flash
    * @param {Color} color The flash-color.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    ###
    flash: (color, duration) ->
        @object.color = color
        color = new Color(color)
        color.alpha = 0
        return @colorTo(color, duration, gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN])
    
    ###*
    * Lets a game object appear on screen using a specified animation.
    *
    * @method appear
    * @param {number} x The x-coordinate of the target-position.
    * @param {number} y The y-coordinate of the target-position.
    * @param {gs.AppearAnimationInfo} animation The animation info-object.
    * @param {Object} easing The easing-type.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###      
    appear: (x, y, animation, easing, duration, callback) ->
        easing = easing || gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN]
        @object.visible = yes

        if animation.type == gs.AnimationTypes.MOVEMENT
            @moveIn(x, y, animation.movement, duration, easing, callback)
        else if animation.type == gs.AnimationTypes.MASKING
            @maskIn(animation.mask, duration, easing, callback)
        else
            @show(duration, easing, callback)
    
    ###*
    * Lets a game object disappear from screen using a specified animation.
    *
    * @method disappear
    * @param {gs.AppearAnimationInfo} animation The animation info-object.
    * @param {Object} easing The easing-type.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback-function called when the animation is finished. 
    ###       
    disappear: (animation, easing, duration, callback) ->
        @object.visible = yes
        if animation.type == gs.AnimationTypes.MOVEMENT
            @moveOut(animation.movement, duration, easing, callback)
        else if animation.type == gs.AnimationTypes.MASKING
            @maskOut(animation.mask, duration, easing, callback)
        else
            @hide(duration, easing, callback)
        

gs.Animator = Component_Animator
gs.Component_Animator = Component_Animator
